Wyclif s declarations of faith, terse and to the point, were very popular; they were subsequently collected and edited together.² We must however, remark that their value is merely that which belongs to a for- mality; they give no proof either for or against Wyclif' s orthodoxy, and it would be mere folly to draw thence any inferences as to our author’s character.
